list.name: Default
list.comment: alerter.py: - Trying to simulate all the possible metric types to get a better picture of the current status in the organization. This information will be used to construct the encoder

task.summary: Default task
anomaly_detector.py - Whooopsie....
metrics_analyzer.py - Whooopsie....

metrics_analyzer.py - Added code for extracting the metric name for the purpose of matching it against the regex and writing it to the logs
anomaly_detector.py: - Added more info in the /ping to help find out why the service is not functioning
anomaly_detector.py: - Forgot to decode the metrics as they arrive from Kafka

anomaly_detector.py: - The method get_anomaly_score() is designed to accept calls via Bottle URLs so instead of calling it directly - using urllib to call it via HTTP.
configurator.py: - Added configuration that will help the anomaly-detector service call itself for detecting anomalies in metrics

anomaly_detector.py: - Added new constant that can be used for debugging to force the service to run on a single thread instead of using Gunicorn - Added code for making the printing of debug message depend on the DEBUG constant - The condition that checks whether the metric name appears in the unique metrics list was incorrectly written - Added try-except block around the addition to the uniqe metrics list to detect issues that prevent the service from working properly now.
metrics_analyzer.py: - Added code for making the printing of debug message depend on the DEBUG constant
configurator.py: - Added configuration of the path to the fonts that are going to be used in the similarity tests
metrics_collector.py: - Fixed an issue with the visual similarity test: it used to refer to fonts at /home/yuval/.fonts which obviously did not exist in production. Now uses a path from the config - Added new constant that can be used for debugging to force the service to run on a single thread instead of using Gunicorn - Added code for making the printing of debug message depend on the DEBUG constant - Added state variable to help identify exception causes
timer.py, tinyurl.py: - Added new constant that can be used for debugging to force the service to run on a single thread instead of using Gunicorn
metrics_analyzer.py, configurator.py, alerter.py: - The code that makes printing of debug messages depended on a constant need a special import in python2.7 - ADDED
metrics_analyzer.py, configurator.py, alerter.py: - It seems that this is a special import that need to be on the first line of the file...

alerter.py: - Added comments that will guide the development of this service
configurator.py: - Added a trailing slash to the URL path just to keep it aligned with the other paths listed
anomaly_detector.py: - Added explicit conversion of the various URL parts to string to avoid the error about concatenating string and int
metrics_collector.py: - Added more specific exceptions to help determine what is causing the similarity check method to fail
metrics_collector.py: - As it turned out, using path.join and sending the right argument starting with a slash causes path.join to return only the argument without the base path.
metrics_collector.py: - Forgot one font....

metrics_collector.py: - Missed couple of debug messages.
anomaly_detector.py: - Added more info in exceptions to make it easier to debug the service - Added counter of metrics that were analyzed successfully
anomaly_detector.py: - Fixed a wrong if (the action if true should be in the case of false)

alerter.py: - Added more comments on how to develop the service - Added more information to the log when the service receives a malformed report
configurator.py: - Added a logging format that will be used across the system to log information to syslog
metrics_analyzer.py: - Using this service as a test case for the logging to syslog with a configured format initiative - Moved the thresholds for anomaly report to the config
anomaly_detector.py: - Switched DEBUG to False to go easy on the disks subsystem - Moved the thresholds for anomaly report to the config
metrics_analyzer.py: - Used the wrong variable... whoopsie

metrics_analyzer.py: - Using different validation of the anomaly report status and sending the report as a string (json.dumps)
alerter.py, metrics_collector.py, timer.py, tinyurl.py, anomaly_detector.py: - Switched to syslog logging with a configured format (instead of stdout/journalctl logging)

metrics_analyzer.py: - Hopefully fixed the problem with the date in the anomaly report.
anomaly_detector.py: - Made the format of the anomaly_info similar to the one from the metrics_analyzer
configurator: - Added indication that all the logs of all the modules belong to the smart-onion
metrics_analyzer.py, anomaly_detector.py: - Converting to float every numeric element in the anomaly report
metrics_analyzer.py, anomaly_detector.py: - Each service is now using different Kafka topic to report anomalies detected by it.

queries.json: - Some queries used the uri field from the LLD to query against the virtual_host field which of-course yielded no results. Created a new version of them that uses the correct field.
timer.py: - Added to the exception about discoveries the discovery URL to help debugging it.

queries.json: - Some LLD queries referred to non-existent queries. Fixed - Some queries required double quotes around the argument. Fixed (at least some...)
metrics_collector: - Added conversion to string before quoting or base64ing since that the value is sometimes float/int.
timer.py: - Added the URL of the discovery to the URLs it generated to assist in troubleshooting the service
queries.json: - The website_pages LLD returned a macro named URL, overwriting the real URL for monitoring

configurator.py: - Now using the same kafka topic for anomalies reported by both services
so-update.sh: - Now deleting all kafka topics during update
metrics_collector.py: - Fixed the discovery so that constructed URLs will be in the same format (e.g. arg1, arg2, argN... etc)

metrics_collector.py: - Accidentally left this service in single threaded mode. FIXED - The exception variable was misnamed
queries.json: - In two queries the order of the arguments was incorrect now. FIXED
so-update.sh: - Trying to make sure that the kafka service is running before deleting all topics
queries.json: - Added double quotes around some query parts

metrics_analyzer.py: - Added the .root folder to the save path of HTM models and anomaly likelihood calcs in case the path exists and does not contain model.pkl (for example in ..tld/gov and ..tld/gov/il) to allow models and calcs to be saved to and read from.
metrics_analyzer.py: - Whooopsssie (-:

metrics_analyzer.py: - Preventing division by zero in homoglyphs ratio detection - Using based64 encoding to overcome any "sql injection" issues (characters in the url that have sql meaning) - Fixed several uses of e as the exception variable instead of ex

metrics_analyzer.py: - Bug in the way base64 encoding was used. FIXED
so-update.sh: - Zookeeper had to be started before starting Kafka (for cleaning up topics)

metrics_collector.py: - Fixed a spot that in debug mode would crash since that it uses a non-existent variable
timer.py: - Styling...
queries.json: - Fixed the top_n_most_rarely_queried_fqdns query so that it will not return empty results
so-clean_all.sh: - Fixed the name of one of the topics
anomaly_detector.py: - Used the wrong kafka topic to pull metrics from.
so-stat.sh: - Added output from the /ping method
smart-onion-metrics_analyzer.py: - Updated models and calcs paths to the correct location

alerter.py: - Now will use only Kafka as the way to report anomalies - Added more comments on how to develop the service - Added dictionaries of metric families (will be used later to encode the anomalies detected)
configurator.py: - Added two more regular expressions that will be used to detect which metrics should be processed by which service
metrics_analyzer.py, anomaly_detector.py, queries.json: - Changed the metrics name format (to help the alerter find out which anomalies contribute to which attack type.
metrics_analyzer.py, anomaly_detector.py, queries.json: - Changed the metrics name format (to help the alerter find out which anomalies contribute to which attack type.
metrics_analyzer.py, anomaly_detector.py: - Whooopsssiee....
alerter.py, anomaly_detector.py: - Whooopsssiee....
alerter.py: - Added flag for the single/multi threading issue. - Added new type of ping that will list all details of metrics detected. Will affect how they're encoded later...
alerter.py: - Added more logs to help find out why the service is not listening...
alerter.py: - Added more logs to help find out why the service is not listening...
alerter.py: - Added more logs to help find out why the service is not listening...
alerter.py: - Fixed an issue with the uniqueness of the metrics list...
alerter.py: - Whooopssiieee
alerter.py: - Whooopssiieee
alerter.py: - Trying single threading...
alerter.py: - Trying to use another level of the metric path
alerter.py: - Trying to simulate all the possible metric types to get a better picture of the current status in the organization. This information will be used to construct the encoder
